> is there 
> some way to start up the server maybe sleep for a couple seconds and 
> then run the client test and shutdown the server?

Easiest approach: use setUp to start the server and sleep and tearDown to 
shut the server down.

Even better: can you have the server notify the test when it has started up? 
That turns an asynchronous call into a more-synchronous call and means you 
won't have false failure when the server takes a little more than your test 
expects to start up.

If you need to start the server, run an entire test *suite*, then shut the 
server down, then you need to use a TestSetup. Look at 
junit.extensions.TestSetup for more information.

Sample use:

MyTestClass {
    public static Test suite() {
        return new TestSetup(new TestSuite(MyTestClass.class)) {
            protected void setUp() throws Exception {
                // This code is run before the test suite.
            }
            protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
                // This code is run *after* the *entire* test suite.
            }
        }
    }
}
